1→import "@mantine/core/styles.css"
     2→
     3→import { MantineProvider } from "@mantine/core"
     4→import { theme } from "./theme/default"
     5→import { SettingsTab } from "./components/settings_tab/SettingsTab"
     6→import { DownloadsTab } from "./components/downloads_tab/DownloadsTab"
     7→import { Tabs } from "./components/tabs/Tabs"
     8→
     9→export function App() {
    10→  const tabs = [
    11→    {
    12→      value: "downloads",
    13→      label: "Downloads",
    14→      content: <DownloadsTab />
    15→    },
    16→    {
    17→      value: "settings",
    18→      label: "Settings",
    19→      content: <SettingsTab />
    20→    }
    21→  ]
    22→
    23→  return (
    24→    <MantineProvider theme={theme} defaultColorScheme="auto">
    25→      <Tabs tabs={tabs} defaultTab="downloads" />
    26→    </MantineProvider>
    27→  )
    28→}
    29→

1→import { Container, Stack, Title, Text } from "@mantine/core"
     2→
     3→export const DownloadsTab = () => {
     4→  return (
     5→    <Container>
     6→      <Stack>
     7→        <Title order={1}>Downloads</Title>
     8→        <Text>No downloads yet</Text>
     9→      </Stack>
    10→    </Container>
    11→  )
    12→}

<system-reminder>

1→import debug from "debug"
     2→
     3→const logger = debug("background")
     4→
     5→logger("background.js loaded 4")
     6→
     7→const openSidePanel = (tab: chrome.tabs.Tab): void => {
     8→  chrome.sidePanel.open({ windowId: tab.windowId })
     9→}
    10→
    11→chrome.action.onClicked.addListener((tab) => {
    12→  openSidePanel(tab)
    13→})
    14→
    15→chrome.commands.onCommand.addListener((command, tab) => {
    16→  if (command === "open-side-panel") {
    17→    openSidePanel(tab)
    18→  } else {
    19→    logger("command not found:", command)
    20→  }
    21→})
    22→

content.text: Based on my analysis of the requirements and existing codebase, I'll create an implementation plan for adding image downloading functionality to this Chrome extension.

input.plan:
# Implementation Plan: Add Image Downloading Feature

## Phase 1: Core Infrastructure & Types (TDD)

### 1.1 Create Download Types & Interfaces
- Create `src/types/downloads.ts` with TypeScript interfaces for:
  - `DownloadStatus` enum (pending, downloading, downloaded, failed)
  - `ImageDownload` interface (id, url, filename, status, progress, etc.)
  - `DownloadGroup` interface (title, pageUrl, downloads, aggregateStatus)
  - `SupportedPageConfig` interface for page-specific logic

### 1.2 Create Download State Management Hook
- Create `src/hooks/useDownloads.ts` with TDD approach:
  - Write failing tests for download queue management
  - Implement Chrome storage integration for persistent downloads
  - Add functions: `queueDownloads`, `updateDownloadStatus`, `retryDownload`
  - Group downloads by page URL with aggregate status logic

## Phase 2: Content Script & Page Detection

### 2.1 Create Page Detection System
- Create `src/utils/pageDetectors.ts` with TDD:
  - Write tests for URL matching logic
  - Implement page detection for localhost test and Pictoa
  - Create page-specific extractors for titles and image URLs

### 2.2 Create Content Script
- Create `src/content.ts`:
  - Inject download button (🚀 icon) on supported pages
  - Handle button clicks to extract and queue images
  - Position button bottom-right with rounded corners
  - Communicate with background script via messaging

### 2.3 Update Manifest Permissions
- Add `activeTab`, `host_permissions` for supported domains
- Add content script registration for supported pages

## Phase 3: Download Engine & Chrome API Integration

### 3.1 Create Download Manager
- Create `src/utils/downloadManager.ts` with TDD:
  - Write tests for download queue processing
  - Implement Chrome Downloads API integration
  - Handle concurrent download limits (max 10 per page)
  - Track download progress and status updates

### 3.2 Update Background Script
- Extend `src/background.ts`:
  - Add message handling for download requests
  - Coordinate between content script and download manager
  - Monitor download events and update storage

## Phase 4: UI Components & Downloads Tab

### 4.1 Create Download UI Components
- Create `src/components/downloads_tab/DownloadItem.tsx` with TDD:
  - Display download status with icons and tooltips
  - Show filename and progress bar for active downloads
  - Add retry button for failed downloads

### 4.2 Create Download Group Component
- Create `src/components/downloads_tab/DownloadGroup.tsx` with TDD:
  - Display page title and clickable URL
  - Show aggregate status icon
  - List all downloads for the page

### 4.3 Update Downloads Tab
- Update `src/components/downloads_tab/DownloadsTab.tsx`:
  - Replace placeholder with actual download groups
  - Handle empty state and loading states
  - Add proper Mantine UI styling

## Phase 5: Testing & Integration

### 5.1 Create Integration Tests
- Test complete flow: page detection → button injection → download queueing
- Test download progress tracking and status updates
- Test retry functionality and error handling

### 5.2 Test with Provided Fixtures
- Test localhost test page functionality
- Verify Pictoa page support (using provided HTML fixture)
- Ensure proper image URL extraction and title parsing

## Phase 6: Error Handling & Polish

### 6.1 Add Comprehensive Error Handling
- Network failure handling with retry logic
- Invalid URL detection and filtering
- Chrome API permission errors

### 6.2 Add Loading States & User Feedback
- Progress indicators during image extraction
- Toast notifications for download completion/failures
- Clear visual feedback for all user actions

---

**Key Implementation Notes:**
- Follow TDD approach: write failing tests first, then implement
- Use existing patterns: Chrome storage hooks, Mantine UI components
- Maintain security: validate URLs, handle untrusted content safely
- Follow existing code conventions: named exports, TypeScript interfaces
- Ensure proper error handling and graceful degradation
